sentences: Ma igaks juhuks kontrollisin artikli veel kord üle.
translation: to be on the safe side
context: The word 'igaks' is an Estonian adverbial expression meaning 'just in case' or 'to be on the safe side'. It's used to take precautions against unforeseen circumstances. 'Igaks' comes from the translative case of 'iga' (every), and when combined with 'juhuks' (chance/possibility), it forms a common phrase expressing precautionary actions.
